description: From the Old French verb retaillier.

entries.meaning: Of or relating to the (actual or figurative) sale of goods or services directly to individuals.
Direct to consumers, in retail quantities, or at retail prices.
examples: We've shut shown our reseller unit. We're only selling retail now.

entries.meaning: (business) The sale of goods directly to the consumer, encompassing the storefronts, mail-order, websites, etc., and the corporate mechanisms, branding, advertising, etc. that support them.
(colloquial) Retail price; full price; an abbreviated expression, meaning the full suggested price of a particular good or service, before any sale, discount, or other deal.
examples: I never pay retail for clothes.

verbs.description: retail (third-person singular simple present retails, present participle retailing, simple past and past participle retailed)

entries.meaning: To sell at retail, or in small quantities directly to customers.
examples: a half part of this purveying is carried on within the city and is called retailing.

entries.meaning: (archaic) To sell secondhand, or in broken parts.
To repeat or circulate (news or rumours) to others.
examples: He became quite pale as he retailed these stories to Constance.
